poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: He knights the horses, pawns his queen Keeps a castle to himself Divvies the rest in equal, run-rig ninths, Waits till the knives and forks are cleared away Then tells them: nice. A bishop: - Is that timeshare nights or days? - What? - The square you're keeping: is it white or black? The king just happens to have a knick-nack Wedge of gneiss and knifes him. Checkmate.
